profileText: A Representative from Connecticut; born in Norwich, Conn., August 27, 1803; attended the common schools; was graduated from Yale College in 1822; studied law; was admitted to the bar and practiced in Norwich; member of the State senate in 1839; judge of the county court; elected as a Whig to the Twenty-ninth and Thirtieth Congresses (March 4, 1845-March 3, 1849); chairman, Committee on Claims (Thirtieth Congress); unsuccessful candidate for reelection in 1848 to the Thirty-first Congress; engaged in the practice of law before the court of claims of the United States at Washington, D.C., until his death in that city on February 10, 1861; interment in Yantic Cemetery, Norwich, Conn.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: Rockwell, John Arnold. Remarks of Mr. Rockwell, of Connecticut, in the House of Representatives U.S., Dec., 15, 1845. [Washington]: J. & G.S. Gideon, printers, [1845?]
------. Speech of Mr. Rockwell, of Connecticut, on the Oregon question. Delivered in the House of Representatives, U.S., January 16, 1846. [Washington, D.C.]: J. & G.S. Gideon, printers, [1846].

researchRecord.name: 1832-1859. 3 boxes.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence and other papers relating to canals and railroads.

researchRecord.name: 1828-1861. ca. 500 items.
researchRecord.description: Business, legal, and political correspondence and papers, chiefly from the 1840's.

researchRecord.name: 1795-1853. 27 documents.
researchRecord.description: Letters to Rockwell and other Norwich citizens concerning politics and business matters.

researchRecord.name: 1791-1871. ca. 3,000 items.
researchRecord.description: Correspondence relating to land development, transportation, politics, his law practice, and development of U.S. Court of Claims. Summary report and catalog cards in library.
